file_content.text: Jiik's going to be alright. He'll just have to stay off the streets for a while.
You'll never find Skavak unless you bust Jiik out of the Justicars' base.
The captain, right? About time you got here!
Thanks to you, the Justicars snagged my brother Jiik. Never should've tangled ourselves in your cloudhead business.
Kid, I have no idea what you're talking about.
Back up and start over.
Typical cloudhead. Don't know which way is up unless a turfer explains it. Listen hard and wise up!
What do you mean by "cloudhead"?
Cloudhead?
You're from where the air is thin and heads are soft. This is turfer land. Wise up and grab some ground!
Better him than me.
That your idea of a joke, cloudhead? I know your kind don't care about turfers, but you'd better start.
I'm Juul. My brother Jiik and I were watching Skavak for you. Big mistake. Nothing but trouble.
Things always go bad for turfers when cloudheads come down here. Never should have took this job.
Are you done berating me yet?
You're a ray of sunshine.
I haven't even started. You kept me worrying and waiting a long time.
Plenty of other ways to earn a living, kid.
So find a new line of work.
What do you know? You live in the clouds. You don't know anything about turfer land.
I've got problems of my own. Just tell me where Skavak is.
Give me my information.
You get yours, and us turfers take care of ourselves, right? Wrong! Now you get to work like us.
Jiik and I were tailing Skavak when the Justicars came after us. Jiik stuck to Skavak. I drew the Justicars.
I lost those helmet-brains easy, but they snagged Jiik and hauled him off to their detention center!
Why would the Justicars arrest your brother?
For what reason?
I don't know. Those lock-steppers make up the rules as they go.
Maybe I can help.
Like you have a choice. Our bad luck is your bad luck.
What am I supposed to do, cry?
You better wise up and start caring about me and my brother.
Jiik knows where Skavak went, but he didn't have time to spill it to me before they snagged him.
You want Skavak? Better prowl into the Justicars' detention center and free my brother.
Jailbreaks aren't exactly easy, kid.
Just like that, huh?
Like I don't know that? But listen, I got an idea how to do it.
Nothing is ever simple.
This is life in turfer land. Welcome to it.
I think you know where Skavak is. Tell me!
You're lying.
Think you can beat answers out of me? Try it. If I don't get my brother back, I don't care if I live.
There's ways into the detention center besides the front door. An old industrial gas tunnel runs right under that place.
The tunnel fumes won't kill you, but you'll come out smelling like rancor droppings. Still, it's the smart turfer's way inside the place.
You're really cramping my style, kid.
This gets worse every second.
If you get killed making some cloudheaded run at the Justicars' front door, who's going to rescue my brother?
I happen to like the smell of rancor droppings.
Doesn't sound so bad.
I can never tell if you cloudheads are joking or just stupid.
I want to kill Justicars. The front door works fine for me.
Forget the tunnel.
Typical cloudhead. You get killed and I never see Jiik again. Great.
Once inside the detention center, you have to bash all the Justicar droid-eyes. That's how they track intruders.
If those droid-eyes aren't rubble, the Justicars will know your face. You don't want that.
Are you making up more words? I've never heard of a "droid-eye" before.
Droid-eyes?
Whatever you call them--it's tech that watches the hallways, okay?
If those idiots want my face on file, they're welcome to it.
The Justicars don't worry me.
You want a price on your head? Fine--but Jiik's in enough trouble. I don't want the Justicars coming after him again.
I was already planning to trash the place, kid.
Smash everything--check.
Make sure you get all the droid-eyes. It's the only way we get out of this clean, understand?
Don't just stand there goggling at me. Get Jiik out of that detention center before something happens to him!
If I do this, you have to stop calling me a cloudhead.
On one condition.
Don't bet on it.
Fine, enough goggling.
Something may have already happened to your brother.
What if he's dead?
Don't say that! If anything happens to Jiik, you won't ever find Skavak.
Take this holotransmitter with you. I want to talk to Jiik as soon as you free him.
You're tracking dirt and blood all over my home, cloudhead. Do you mind?
